page.title: 17The Church in Great Bromley
page.content: {St.Georges Church}dates from the{12th} {century}.It is said to be one of the finest churches in Essex. In the past a{rood beam}supported a Cross above the chancel.The steps enabling people to climb up to the beam are still visible.The beam was ordered to be removed by{Thomas } {Wolsey in 1540.} The Church has a ringing chamber with 6 bells. It is a{custom}that when the head bell ringer retires, he hangs his cap in the bell chamber. There are 7 caps hanging there dating from 1717. The East & the American Windows are stained glass.The East window shows sheaves of corn, apples, a lamb & some{broom}.The first 3 indicate the main occupations of the parish and the last, the{origin of the name of the {village}; a clearing in the broom.
